item.title: Laurel add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Being a Humanist means trying to behave decently without expectation of rewards or punishment after you are dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "In wine there is wisdom, in beer there is Freedom, in water there is bacteria." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Laurel add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the strength to start all over again." -- Eric Roth
